content:
TITLE: Configuring OpenManus with LLM API Settings
DESCRIPTION: Example TOML configuration for OpenManus, defining the LLM model, API keys, and other parameters needed for the AI agent to function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mannaandpoem/OpenManus/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: toml
CODE:
```
# Global LLM configuration
[llm]
model = "gpt-4o"
base_url = "https://api.openai.com/v1"
api_key = "sk-..."  # Replace with your actual API key
max_tokens = 4096
temperature = 0.0

# Optional configuration for specific LLM models
[llm.vision]
model = "gpt-4o"
base_url = "https://api.openai.com/v1"
api_key = "sk-..."  # Replace with your actual API key
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing OpenManus Using uv Package Manager
DESCRIPTION: Commands for setting up OpenManus using uv, a faster Python package installer and resolver, including installation of uv itself, cloning the repository, creating a virtual environment, and installing dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mannaandpoem/OpenManus/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/mannaandpoem/OpenManus.git
cd OpenManus
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
uv venv --python 3.12
source .venv/bin/activate  # On Unix/macOS
# Or on Windows:
# .venv\Scripts\activate
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
uv pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing OpenManus Using conda Environment
DESCRIPTION: Commands for setting up OpenManus using conda to create a Python environment, clone the repository, and install dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mannaandpoem/OpenManus/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
conda create -n open_manus python=3.12
conda activate open_manus
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/mannaandpoem/OpenManus.git
cd OpenManus
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running OpenManus in Standard Mode
DESCRIPTION: Command to run OpenManus in its standard mode, which allows users to input their ideas via terminal.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mannaandpoem/OpenManus/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python main.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running OpenManus in MCP Tool Mode
DESCRIPTION: Command to run OpenManus in MCP (Multiple Compute Providers) tool mode, which is an alternative execution method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mannaandpoem/OpenManus/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python run_mcp.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Configuration File from Example
DESCRIPTION: Command to copy the example configuration file to create a custom configuration file for OpenManus.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mannaandpoem/OpenManus/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cp config/config.example.toml config/config.toml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Playwright for Browser Automation
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Playwright, an optional browser automation tool used by OpenManus for web interactions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mannaandpoem/OpenManus/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
playwright install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running OpenManus in Multi-Agent Mode
DESCRIPTION: Command to run OpenManus in its experimental multi-agent mode, which is described as unstable but available for testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mannaandpoem/OpenManus/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python run_flow.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Japan Travel Itinerary Prompt
DESCRIPTION: A prompt designed to generate a detailed 7-day Japan travel itinerary with specific requirements including budget constraints, activity preferences, and a proposal planning element. The prompt requests output in HTML format with additional travel resources.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mannaandpoem/OpenManus/blob/main/examples/use_case/readme.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
I need a 7-day Japan itinerary for April 15-23 from Seattle, with a $2500-5000 budget for my fianc√©e and me. We love historical sites, hidden gems, and Japanese culture (kendo, tea ceremonies, Zen meditation). We want to see Nara's deer and explore cities on foot. I plan to propose during this trip and need a special location recommendation. Please provide a detailed itinerary and a simple HTML travel handbook with maps, attraction descriptions, essential Japanese phrases, and travel tips we can reference throughout our journey.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: BibTeX Citation for OpenManus
DESCRIPTION: BibTeX entry for citing the OpenManus project in academic work, including author information, title, publisher, and DOI.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mannaandpoem/OpenManus/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bibtex
CODE:
```
@misc{openmanus2025,
  author = {Xinbin Liang and Jinyu Xiang and Zhaoyang Yu and Jiayi Zhang and Sirui Hong and Sheng Fan and Xiao Tang},
  title = {OpenManus: An open-source framework for building general AI agents},
  year = {2025},
  publisher = {Zenodo},
  doi = {10.5281/zenodo.15186407},
  url = {https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15186407},
}
```
